18 * in OpenLDAP Software. Additional significant contributors include:
19 * Stuart Lynne

22/*
23 * This is an improved implementation of Reader/Writer locks does
24 * not protect writers from starvation. That is, if a writer is
25 * currently waiting on a reader, any new reader will get
26 * the lock before the writer.
27 *
28 * Does not support cancellation nor does any status checking.
29 */
30/* Adapted from publically available examples for:
31 * "Programming with Posix Threads"
32 * by David R Butenhof, Addison-Wesley
33 * http://cseng.aw.com/bookpage.taf?ISBN=0-201-63392-2
34 */
35
36#include <sys/cdefs.h>
37__RCSID("$NetBSD: rdwr.c,v 1.1.1.6 2018/02/06 01:53:08 christos Exp $");
38
39#include "portable.h"
40
41#include <ac/stdlib.h>
42
43#include <ac/errno.h>
44#include <ac/string.h>
45#include <ac/time.h>
46
47#include "ldap-int.h"
48#include "ldap_pvt_thread.h" /* Get the thread interface */
49#define LDAP_THREAD_RDWR_IMPLEMENTATION
50#include "ldap_thr_debug.h" /* May rename the symbols defined below */
51
52/*
53 * implementations that provide their own compatible
54 * reader/writer locks define LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_RDWR
55 * in ldap_pvt_thread.h
56 */
57#ifndef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_RDWR
58
59struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s {
60 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t ltrw_mutex;
61 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_t ltrw_read; /* wait for read */
62 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_t ltrw_write; /* wait for write */
63 int ltrw_valid;
64#define LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID 0x0bad
65 int ltrw_r_active;
66 int ltrw_w_active;
67 int ltrw_r_wait;
68 int ltrw_w_wait;
69#ifdef LDAP_RDWR_DEBUG
70 /* keep track of who has these locks */
71#define MAX_READERS 32
72 int ltrw_more_readers; /* Set if ltrw_readers[] is incomplete */
73 ldap_pvt_thread_t ltrw_readers[MAX_READERS];
74 ldap_pvt_thread_t ltrw_writer;
75#endif
76};
77
78int
79ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_init( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock )
80{
81 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
82
83 assert( rwlock != NULL );
84
85 rw = (struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *) LDAP_CALLOC( 1,
86 sizeof( struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s ) );
87 if ( !rw )
88 return LDAP_NO_MEMORY;
89
90 /* we should check return results */
91 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_init( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
92 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_init( &rw->ltrw_read );
93 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_init( &rw->ltrw_write );
94
95 rw->ltrw_valid = LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID;
96
97 *rwlock = rw;
98 return 0;
99}
100
101int
102ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_destroy( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock )
103{
104 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
105
106 assert( rwlock != NULL );
107 rw = *rwlock;
108
109 assert( rw != NULL );
110 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
111
112 if( rw->ltrw_valid != LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID )
113 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EINVAL;
114
115 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
116
117 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
118 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
119 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
120 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
121
122 /* active threads? */
123 if( rw->ltrw_r_active > 0 || rw->ltrw_w_active > 0) {
124 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
125 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EBUSY;
126 }
127
128 /* waiting threads? */
129 if( rw->ltrw_r_wait > 0 || rw->ltrw_w_wait > 0) {
130 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
131 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EBUSY;
132 }
133
134 rw->ltrw_valid = 0;
135
136 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
137
138 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_destroy( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
139 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_destroy( &rw->ltrw_read );
140 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_destroy( &rw->ltrw_write );
141
142 LDAP_FREE(rw);
143 *rwlock = NULL;
144 return 0;
145}
146
147int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_rlock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock )
148{
149 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
150
151 assert( rwlock != NULL );
152 rw = *rwlock;
153
154 assert( rw != NULL );
155 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
156
157 if( rw->ltrw_valid != LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID )
158 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EINVAL;
159
160 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
161
162 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
163 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
164 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
165 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
166
167 if( rw->ltrw_w_active > 0 ) {
168 /* writer is active */
169
170 rw->ltrw_r_wait++;
171
172 do {
173 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_wait(
174 &rw->ltrw_read, &rw->ltrw_mutex );
175 } while( rw->ltrw_w_active > 0 );
176
177 rw->ltrw_r_wait--;
178 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
179 }
180
181#ifdef LDAP_RDWR_DEBUG
182 if( rw->ltrw_r_active < MAX_READERS )
183 rw->ltrw_readers[rw->ltrw_r_active] = ldap_pvt_thread_self();
184 else
185 rw->ltrw_more_readers = 1;
186#endif
187 rw->ltrw_r_active++;
188
189
190 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
191
192 return 0;
193}
194
195int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_rtrylock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock )
196{
197 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
198
199 assert( rwlock != NULL );
200 rw = *rwlock;
201
202 assert( rw != NULL );
203 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
204
205 if( rw->ltrw_valid != LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID )
206 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EINVAL;
207
208 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
209
210 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
211 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
212 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
213 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
214
215 if( rw->ltrw_w_active > 0) {
216 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
217 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EBUSY;
218 }
219
220#ifdef LDAP_RDWR_DEBUG
221 if( rw->ltrw_r_active < MAX_READERS )
222 rw->ltrw_readers[rw->ltrw_r_active] = ldap_pvt_thread_self();
223 else
224 rw->ltrw_more_readers = 1;
225#endif
226 rw->ltrw_r_active++;
227
228 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
229
230 return 0;
231}
232
233int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_runlock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock )
234{
235 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
236
237 assert( rwlock != NULL );
238 rw = *rwlock;
239
240 assert( rw != NULL );
241 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
242
243 if( rw->ltrw_valid != LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID )
244 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EINVAL;
245
246 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
247
248 rw->ltrw_r_active--;
249#ifdef LDAP_RDWR_DEBUG
250 /* Remove us from the list of readers */
251 {
252 ldap_pvt_thread_t self = ldap_pvt_thread_self();
253 int i, j;
254 for( i = j = rw->ltrw_r_active; i >= 0; i--) {
255 if (rw->ltrw_readers[i] == self) {
256 rw->ltrw_readers[i] = rw->ltrw_readers[j];
257 rw->ltrw_readers[j] = 0;
258 break;
259 }
260 }
261 if( !rw->ltrw_more_readers )
262 assert( i >= 0 );
263 else if( j == 0 )
264 rw->ltrw_more_readers = 0;
265 }
266#endif
267
268 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
269 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
270 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
271 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
272
273 if (rw->ltrw_r_active == 0 && rw->ltrw_w_wait > 0 ) {
274 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_signal( &rw->ltrw_write );
275 }
276
277 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
278
279 return 0;
280}
281
282int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_wlock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock )
283{
284 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
285
286 assert( rwlock != NULL );
287 rw = *rwlock;
288
289 assert( rw != NULL );
290 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
291
292 if( rw->ltrw_valid != LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID )
293 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EINVAL;
294
295 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
296
297 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
298 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
299 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
300 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
301
302 if ( rw->ltrw_w_active > 0 || rw->ltrw_r_active > 0 ) {
303 rw->ltrw_w_wait++;
304
305 do {
306 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_wait(
307 &rw->ltrw_write, &rw->ltrw_mutex );
308 } while ( rw->ltrw_w_active > 0 || rw->ltrw_r_active > 0 );
309
310 rw->ltrw_w_wait--;
311 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
312 }
313
314#ifdef LDAP_RDWR_DEBUG
315 rw->ltrw_writer = ldap_pvt_thread_self();
316#endif
317 rw->ltrw_w_active++;
318
319 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
320
321 return 0;
322}
323
324int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_wtrylock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock )
325{
326 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
327
328 assert( rwlock != NULL );
329 rw = *rwlock;
330
331 assert( rw != NULL );
332 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
333
334 if( rw->ltrw_valid != LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID )
335 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EINVAL;
336
337 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
338
339 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
340 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
341 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
342 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
343
344 if ( rw->ltrw_w_active > 0 || rw->ltrw_r_active > 0 ) {
345 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
346 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EBUSY;
347 }
348
349#ifdef LDAP_RDWR_DEBUG
350 rw->ltrw_writer = ldap_pvt_thread_self();
351#endif
352 rw->ltrw_w_active++;
353
354 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
355
356 return 0;
357}
358
359int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_wunlock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock )
360{
361 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
362
363 assert( rwlock != NULL );
364 rw = *rwlock;
365
366 assert( rw != NULL );
367 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
368
369 if( rw->ltrw_valid != LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID )
370 return LDAP_PVT_THREAD_EINVAL;
371
372 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
373
374 rw->ltrw_w_active--;
375
376 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
377 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
378 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
379 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
380
381 if (rw->ltrw_r_wait > 0) {
382 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_broadcast( &rw->ltrw_read );
383
384 } else if (rw->ltrw_w_wait > 0) {
385 ldap_pvt_thread_cond_signal( &rw->ltrw_write );
386 }
387
388#ifdef LDAP_RDWR_DEBUG
389 assert( rw->ltrw_writer == ldap_pvt_thread_self() );
390 rw->ltrw_writer = 0;
391#endif
392 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( &rw->ltrw_mutex );
393
394 return 0;
395}
396
397#ifdef LDAP_RDWR_DEBUG
398
399/* just for testing,
400 * return 0 if false, suitable for assert(ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_Xchk(rdwr))
401 *
402 * Currently they don't check if the calling thread is the one
403 * that has the lock, just that there is a reader or writer.
404 *
405 * Basically sufficent for testing that places that should have
406 * a lock are caught.
407 */
408
409int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_readers(ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock)
410{
411 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
412
413 assert( rwlock != NULL );
414 rw = *rwlock;
415
416 assert( rw != NULL );
417 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
418 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
419 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
420 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
421 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
422
423 return( rw->ltrw_r_active );
424}
425
426int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_writers(ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock)
427{
428 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
429
430 assert( rwlock != NULL );
431 rw = *rwlock;
432
433 assert( rw != NULL );
434 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
435 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
436 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
437 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
438 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
439
440 return( rw->ltrw_w_active );
441}
442
443int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_active(ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rwlock)
444{
445 struct ldap_int_thread_rdwr_s *rw;
446
447 assert( rwlock != NULL );
448 rw = *rwlock;
449
450 assert( rw != NULL );
451 assert( rw->ltrw_valid == LDAP_PVT_THREAD_RDWR_VALID );
452 assert( rw->ltrw_w_active >= 0 );
453 assert( rw->ltrw_w_wait >= 0 );
454 assert( rw->ltrw_r_active >= 0 );
455 assert( rw->ltrw_r_wait >= 0 );
456
457 return(ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_readers(rwlock) +
458 ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_writers(rwlock));
459}
460
461#endif /* LDAP_RDWR_DEBUG */
462
463#endif /* LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_RDWR */
